towns.town: wäräda Gulo Mäkäda, ṭabiya Marta, qušät Sämaz

founders.founder: Local tradition claims that the first church on this site was built by King ʿAmdä Ṣǝyon I (r. 1314-34). Among the local tabots, one is dedicated to Mäṭaʿ/Libanos, and one to ʾabba ʾAnanya, a head of Däbrä Ṣärabi, one of the main ʾEwosṭatean communities. An ancient (Aksumite?) pillar stands in the doorway of the gate house, and another one is included in the masonry of the wall. Several window grills, carved of stone, have been inserted in the windows of the gate house and of a half-ruined building to the left from the entrance. Sämaz is mentioned in one of the documents of the "Golden Gospel" of Däbrä Libanos of Ham. An Additio to the Mäṣḥafä aslǝṭi (SMM-003) written by Zä-Wäldä Maryam, a local mid-18th-cent. scribe, recounts that the sanctuary of Sämaz was built by ʾabunä ʿAṣfä Dǝngǝl “on three stone pillars”. Sämaz was favored by ras ʾArʾaya Śǝllase (ca. 1869-88), a son of King Yoḥannǝs IV, who donated at least one book to the church.

conditions.condition: Gädam. Formally, Sämaz Maryam is a monastery, but the monastic community declined in 1980-90s; currently, there are no monks. Tabots (7): Mary, Libanos, ʾAnanya, Yoḥannǝs Käma, Michael, Gabriel, Qirqos.

abouts.about: C. Conti Rossini, “L’Evangelo d’oro di Dabra Libanos”, Rendiconti della Reale Accademia dei Lincei. Classe di scienze morali, storiche e filologiche, s. 5, 10 (1901), pp. 177–219, here p. 184, l.6; 185, l.3.

others.other: In the background of the compound, there is a ṣäbäl-water attended by many people. The local climate of Sämaz is very humid and hot, and might severely affect parchment manuscripts.

descriptions.description: 7 Mss. photographed (ca. 13 recent Mss. left): SMM-001 "The Rite of the Holy Week"; SMM-002 "Miracles of Mary"; SMM-003 "The Book of aslǝṭi"; SMM-004 "Prayers of the Faith"; SMM-005 "The Book of the Matrimony Rite"; SMM-006 "Collection of liturgical prayers"; SMM-007 "Missal"
